intro: Corydalis trachycarpa var. octocornuta, commonly known as the hairy corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the genus Corydalis. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant spring blooms and unique foliage structure.
